column4: so I switched my keyboard layout to Dvorak, but the keymappings are still QWERTY when using the Ctrl key
that's pretty weird.  You're on ubuntu right, not OS X?
yep, ubuntu lucid.  and older programs like xpdf register the keystroke locations, not identities, effectively hardcoding the qwerty layout
so is the issue only with these older programs?
i hit ctrl-f in dvorak and the search pops up in xpdf.  I'm not sure what you are saynig
the issue is with all Ctrl-key combos; the xpdf bit was a sidenote and occurs for single keystrokes (not Ctrl'd)
can you give me an example in xpdf?  I'm not familiar with the key shortcuts
sure, if I want to quit xpdf, hitting the Dvorak 'q' has no result; hitting the Dvorak ';' aka the qwerty 'q' successfully exits the program
q on dvorak works here, ; in dvorak does nothing.  Hmm.  Note I'm not in gnome atm
Hmm, I am in gnome, I think you may have helped identify the culprit, haha
try something like fluxbox just to verify
the Dvorak keystrokes worked in fluxbox, that isolates the problem to gnome, thanks!
maybe check Keyboard Properties for some obscure option
didn't find anything obvious, I'll check the gnome bugs for something similar
maybe "keys to change layout" in layout options
I've got that set to both Alt keys, shouldn't affect it
oh, I just noticed "ctrl while pressed there".  Tried toggling it?
and one of the Alt keys doesn't work! haha, so hopefully I've rendered that option ineffective
or see if removing the other layouts you have temporarily changes the behavior in xpdf
wow, that did it, I had to move the Dvorak to the top of the list of layouts
interesting.  Still sounds buggy if you didn't select any option for that though
agreed, there are 'move up' and 'move down' options for the group of layouts, but it doesn't imply the order actually matters
